incident_details: Teenager arrested for making threats towards the school, which uncovered additional criminal activity
Student made a bomb threat and law enforcement was notified by the FBI about the bomb threat
Student threatened other students during a verbal argument
Student made a threat on social media and it was shared with other students
School learned about concerning posts on social media, leading to the school to seek additional police presence. Social Media page was taken down.
School received a bomb threat the first day after returning from Holiday Break
Social Media user made threats to 14 schools in Texas, 3 of which were elementary schools in the Austin ISD. The threat included a photo of a masked person with a gun.
Female Student reported that a boy made a threat referencing a firearm.
charges: Criminal Threat and Aggravated Criminal Threat

incident_details: Parents went to police and told them their daughter was showing warning signs of potentially hurting herself and others by committing a school shooting. During the investigation, police found out she dressed up as a school shooter for Halloween, researched school shootings, and a lot of references to Columbine. She felt like she could relate to Columbine shooter Eric Harris. She had multiple pictures of the Columbine shooters on her phone. Learned that she was planning to do a shooting with a transgender male named Nathan, recorded a video of the school to show how they could get in and out, and agreed upon 5/25/26 being the date of the school shooting.
charges: Attempted Murder, Conspiracy to Commit Murder, and Intimidation

incident_details: Student of the school posted a photo of herself with the caption, "i'm abt to shoot up this school" and "they done pissed me tf off". Said she posted it in frustration after she got a dress code violation.
charges: Written threats to commit a mass shooting

incident_details: Video depicted a man wearing a yellow hockey mask, holding a pistol, and in front of a Nazi Flag saying, "Many people will die. We will kill in everyway possible: shooting, bombing, cutting. We will be as cruel as possible. Person used a voice-distortion filter and claimed to belong to a group called ENDTEX. Video originated outside the U.S.
Bomb threat forces school closure and was reported that multiple schools received a bomb threat
Juvenile made a threat on Discord to harm students and staff. Juvenile lived in a different county
School received an email that made a bomb and shooting threat
School found a written threat of violence in a restroom
School received a call indicating there were bombs on campus
Expelled student showed up to school and threatened a student with a knife.
charges: Second-degree assault, making death threats, trespassing, disruption of school activities, and weapons on school property

incident_details: Student reported hearing a threat on campus. Update provide mentioned the student heard about a possible weapon on campus
Reported threat determined to be not credible and to have originated outside of the United States. Connected to another Texas incident above.
Suspect called the school while under the influence of alcohol and threatened physical violence against a staff member
charges: Criminal Threat, Harassment by Telecommunication Device, and Battery of a Law Enforcement Officer
Making a terroristic threat, disorderly conduct- threat of violence on or at school property, disorderly conduct- reporting a false alarm or complaint via 911

incident_details: School received a threat via phone call, prompting a hard lockdown at multiple Yuba County Schools
precautions: Deputy stationed at each campus for the remainder of the day

school: Gates Chili Central and East Irondequoit Central School Districts
incident_details: Students reported seeing a video on TikTok where vague threats were made to multiple county schools across New York. The video originated out of Texas.
Police received information that a student brandished a firearm outside the school. Student was arrested after he fabricated the story for attention.
charges: Issuing a false alarm or police report

incident_details: Juvenile sent a threat directed towards the middle school and claimed it was a joke
The following message was found on the bathroom wall: "I am going to bomb this school"
School went into lockdown after receiving a tip about a possible threat. School determined it was a hoax and conducted a controlled dismissal.

Caller contacted the school claiming to be outside with a rifle and threatening to assault staff and students. Call was trace to Florida, as the suspect used a Google Voice Number that was tied to an IP in the state.
precautions: Sheriff's Deputy remained stationed at the school for the day
charges: False report concerning planting a bomb, an explosive, or a weapon of mass destruction, or concerning the use of firearms in a violent manner and unlawful use of a two-way communication device

incident_details: Someone called and said they had been notified that a student intended to bring a weapon to school
Individual threatened an educational institution outside the city of Summit, forcing two schools to shelter in place
School received a late night robot-generated phone call indicating that there were bombs on campus. Believed to be AI Generated.
Nearly half a dozen schools received an AI generated phone call that made a bomb threat. It targeted primarily private and charter schools.
Student made a threat against the school for the day.
Posts alleged violence towards the school but was determined to be a video that is several years old.
Student reported seeing a threat on Instagram from an unknown account.
charges: Threats and Interference with or disruption of an educational institution

incident_details: Student wrote in a notebook threats directed towards other students. Student wrote the statements based on a TV Show he had seen.
School received a bomb threat leading to a lockdown.

school: Boyd County Middle School and Ashland Middle School
incident_details: Ashland Water Treatment Plant received a call from an individual stating that they were going to get a gun and go to the two schools. Phone number is connected to an incident that occurred in Texas on January 7.
Swatting Hoax.

School received a phone call with a computer-generated voice claiming that explosive devices had been planted in the school and warns if the devices are moved or tampered with, that they would shoot every student in the school.
precautions: Increased Law Enforcement Presence and Counselors available for students

school: Algonac Jr. and Sr. High School

incident_details: Social Media post involved a weapon with threatening language. The threat was vague where it was not determined who it was towards. Weapon used on the post was pulled from an internet source.

School received a phone call in the early hours where an individual identified themselves as a student and stated he intended to bring a bomb and a firearm to the school due to a prior bullying incident.

school: Danville Local Schools and East Knox Schools
incident_details: School received a call about someone possibly coming to school with a firearm
Bomb threat at the school's library
Bomb threat to multiple university buildings, prompting building closures
Bomb Threat in which law enforcement stated that they thought it may have been AI.

law_enforcement: University of Nebraska Police and Public Safety Department
incident_details: Bomb threat to school's library
Online threat prompts the school to evacuate the library and search the building.
School received a bomb threat towards their library
Reported bomb threat and a student claimed to have an assault rifle and that they were going to try and take their life and other students lives.
Juvenile made threats to shoot up the school and was attempting to gain access to a firearm. Juvenile admitted to threats and that he was trying to get a firearm to carry out those threats.
charges: Exhibition, use, or threat of exhibition or use of a firearm

incident_details: Received a call stating that there was a bomb at Huntington High School
Suspect yelled out that she would blow up the school
Student was reportedly overheard saying he was going to shoot a teacher and principal the next day
Student told a parent that another student may be bringing a gun to school
precautions: Limited Entry into the school to one area.

charges: Suspicion of Intimidation and Invasion of Privacy

incident_details: Multiple schools threatened across the state. Including schools in Douglas County School District, Littleton Public Schools, Frisco, Alamosa, and Buena Vista. It is believed to be AI-Generated robocall.

school: Port St. Joe High School and Elementary School
incident_details: Schools were dismissed early due to a credible threat to a specific individual. In an update, police believed the calls were placed by a computer based calling program and was in response to a video on social media showing a fight.
Written shooting threat found in the school facility
Classes cancelled after an external contractor made a threat on school grounds and in another incident, two students were overheard potentially discussing bringing weapons to school

charges: Making a threat to kill or do bodily injury to a school teacher on academy property

incident_details: Police department received a call from a person claiming they are armed and on their way to the school to commit a shooting. Person called back claiming that they were in the school but was scared and did not want to be arrested.
Rumors and Gossip increased regarding the original threat from two days prior, leading to an early dismissal.
Rumor of a threat of violence

Suspect told multiple juvenile witnesses on various occasions that he would carry out a shooting at the school and that the suspect had been observed with a handgun over the past few weeks. Gun was a modified airsoft gun.
Rumors about a potential school shooting incident that would occur during the week of January 12
Adult threatened harm at a school due to frustration over a game outcome.
Received a hoax call about an active shooter
Two students reported receiving threatening messages including, "Ima bomb yall school"
precautions: Increased Law Enforcement Presence for the rest of the day

incident_details: Juvenile outside the county made gun violence threats towards the school
Two juveniles from Pittsburg High School made a threat on an anonymous video chat platform, leading to a person in Connecticut who overheard it to report it.
Written threat found in the bathroom.
Student brought a gun to school after threatening another student. Dad arrested for not safely securing his firearm.
charges: Possession of a firearm by a minor, misconduct involving weapons, and threats/ disruption of an educational institution

incident_details: Student posted a video on TikTok that indicated he had a weapon and dispatch reports indicate that the student had threatened to use it at the school. A knife was found in the locker of the student who posted the video.

school: Southern Baptist Theological Seminary/ Boyce College

incident_details: Neighbor of the school left a note with a threatening message on the window. A fifth grade class witnessed the incident. Suspect was placed in a mental health facility after the incident. Note on the window threatened to shoot six people at the school and that he wanted to teach them a lesson. Note said "It could be any day. Till six lives of this school are killed. It might even be today, Jan 16. When you see this, don't think you will be alive much longer." He previously made a threat to the same teacher.
Threatening Graffiti found in campus restroom
precautions: Increased Law Enforcement Presence and increased security measures
Parents could pull their kids out of school early

school: Multiple Schools in Rocky Mount Area
lockdown_type: One in soft lockdown and four in secure

precautions: Law Enforcement Presence for the remainder of the day
Parents could pick students up early and after school activities cancelled

incident_details: Other schools threatened include Canyon Hills High School, Kearney High School, and Jonas Salk Elementary School
School Counselor received a phone call from someone threatening to shoot up the school
Facebook post shows that the suspect made a threat to "shoot" an unspecified school in Albany.

Old Town Elementary was the first to receive a phone call threat for a person with a firearm making threats. Houlton Elementary received a call at 8:10 a.m. where an unknown caller threatened to do harm with a firearm.
lockdown_type: Multiple lockdowns and shelter in place
precautions: Law Enforcement Presence for the day and School Counselors Available Upon Request

incident_details: Bomb threat was found written in the bathroom. It said, "I am going to bomb the school"
precautions: All students searched by school officials entering the building the next morning

incident_details: Yargo Elementary, Winder Elementary, and Apalachee High School all received threats
precautions: Increased Law Enforcement on Each Campus

incident_details: School received a call from someone claiming that they were inside the school's restroom with the intentions of shooting up the school.
Suspect called the Police Department and threatened to shoot members of the College's Administration and public safety officers.
weapons: Numerous firearms turned over by suspect's family
charges: Making a Threat of Mass Violence

incident_details: Threat was found written on a bathroom wall

Douglas County School District closed after receiving a bomb threat. Carson High School was placed on Hold after receiving a threat. Douglas, Storey, Lyon, Carson, and Churchhill counties all received threats.
School received a call regarding a weapon and bomb threat. Call came from out of the country.

school: Multiple School Districts in New York
incident_details: Depew Free Union School District received a threat towards its high school. Hamburg School District received threats. Officials believe these threats were made to disrupt Regent Exams and other school events. Other districts include Akron, Amherst, Cheektowaga, and Ken-Ton.
Juvenile made a threat to a school outside of the county they live in.
Shooting threat originated from an account registered to an individual in Connecticut
Student made statements about bringing a gun to school with plans to harm other students on Friday January 23

precautions: Increased Law Enforcement Presence for the Day

incident_details: One email contained a bomb threat to Palladium Residence Hall and a threat to space within the Silver Center Residence Hall. Emails included offensive and racist language.
Bomb threat found written on the wall
Staff received an email that had racial slurs and threats
Received a threat to campus safety
Emailed threat originated from overseas
Suspect posted a photo online of the school with numerous threats of violence

A woman called and said she was in Carlsbad, New Mexico, and reported receiving a phone call from an unknown person who claimed to have overheard a conversation in a bathroom suggesting there might be bombs on campus. When asked for her phone number, she hung up. Attempts to call her back were unsuccessful due to the number being blocked and the address she provided was invalid.
School provided an update on the threat the school received. Phone Call was traced and there are indications it was routed through a Maryland number from outside the country.
Staff member received a phone call that they perceived as a threat, forcing a modified lockdown

charges: Making Criminal Threats to a School
Making a terroristic threat and interference with or disruption of an educational institution

incident_details: Student made a verbal threat to another student and was found with a lighter that resembled a handgun
A juvenile in Massachusetts made a threat online to a school in Virginia.
Student posted on their social media that they "want to commit Columbine Pt2" Student said the post was intended to be "dark humor".
charges: Written or electronic threat to conduct a mass shooting or act of terrorism and unlawful use of two-way communication device

incident_details: A video was received showing a person bringing a gun into a classroom. It was determined the video was recorded last fall and resurfaced.
Police received a report of a threat at the high school, where a student had plans to kill a classmate. Two suspects were identified and in one of the students' bags, they found a knife and a note.
Police received a report of shots fired near the University of Wisconsin-Whitewater at Rock County Campus

school: Summit Academy North Middle and High School

incident_details: School received a report of a possible threat. A student made an inappropriate comment based on a rumor.
Police received a call that a student was going to shoot up the school

Suspect wrote, "I will shoot up the school (NSHS) on 1-18-2026â¦I am dangerous someone stop me. There are nail bombs in the rotunda. I will pop the kids." and "I will kill minors and rape dead bodies LOL."
Juvenile threatened to bring a weapon to school in front of others
Juvenile stated that he would shoot up DeLand High School
Unknown suspect typed into a calculator that there were going to shoot up the school
School received a voicemail over the weekend that was computer generated that indicated that there were bombs placed on campus and was set to detonate while school was in session Monday
precautions: Law Enforcement Presence and Advisors/ School's Mental Health Team available to meet with

incident_details: Voicemail of a bomb threat made Sunday Morning was not discovered until Monday Morning.
precautions: Increased Law Enforcement Presence and School Counselors available
Staff available to meet with students to provide support in dealing with the incident

school: Oak Park and River Forest High School
incident_details: School received a bomb threat, prompting the school to go on Hold Status. The VPN used was tracked to overseas.
School of Law received a threat, prompting an evacuation.

precautions: More officers at schools throughout the city

incident_details: Witness reported that someone with a strange voice called and said there was a bomb threat inside the school before disconnecting the line
School received a voicemail that there were multiple bombs placed inside the building.

school: Darrington Elementary and Darrington High School
incident_details: School District's Administrative Office Received a Phone Call about a bomb threat. Person on the line used an automated voice.

Fort Vancouver High School, Marshall Elementary School, Edgewood Elementary School, Truman Elementary School, McLoughlin Middle School, and the Heights Campus all received threats. Some calls threatened a person was coming to the school with weapons, other calls threatened that a bomb was at the school. Calls came from a blocked number and were automated.
School District became aware of a social media rumor regarding possible weapons on campus at the school.
precautions: Additional Security and Officers at the School

school: Two Charter Schools in Amarillo, Texas
Ashley Elementary School and Lucile Souders Elementary School

incident_details: Northern Nash High School, Red Oak Elementary, Red Oak Middle School, and Rocky Mount High School all received threats on social media. Two females were arrested for the separate incidents.
charges: Both charged with Communicating a Threat of Mass Violence on Educational Property

incident_details: Threatening voicemail left at the district's central office from an anonymous number.

charges: Communicating a Threat of Mass Violence on Educational Property

incident_details: School received an automated voice message voicemail overnight.
Threatening Phone Call was described as an inappropriate message
Suspect threatened to bomb the school. Called from a Halfway House.
charges: Threatening to Discharge a Destructive Device and Making a False Report Concerning a Bomb

incident_details: Person called the school to express anger over the noise associated with the PA system broadcasting the pledge of allegiance, routine duties, and bell schedule, and threatened to blow up the school if the PA system did not stop

precautions: Increased Law Enforcement Presence and School Counselors available for support

incident_details: Burns Jr./Sr. High School and Pine Bluffs High School all received threats. Voice sounded computer generated and foreign. Call came from out of the country.

school: Worland High School and Ten Step Schools
incident_details: Upton High School and Saratoga High School also received threats
School received a voicemail that was set to detonate at 1 p.m. and threatened more violence if anyone interfered

school: Limestone Community School and Maine School of Science and Mathematics
incident_details: School received a phone call threatening a shooting.
Threat made to the school through an anonymous report.
precautions: Law Enforcement Remained on Campus for the Day

incident_details: Voicemail left a bomb threat but did not name a specific school
911 dispatch received a call that bombs were placed on campus
precautions: Addtitional Law Enforcement Presence on Campus

incident_details: School received a voicemail that stated pipe bombs were placed around the school and that a person armed with an AR-15 and wearing a suicide vest was on campus
After an extensive investigation, it was determined that a fight at school and threats of violence at a different location led to inaccurate information to spread across social media.
School received a call that there was a bomb in a backpack on campus
School received an unverified threat over the phone
precautions: Modest Law Enforfement Presence at the School for the day

incident_details: Redwood High School, San Andreas High School, and Tamiscal High School all received threats, leading to all schools being evacuated.
precautions: Counselors and Wellness Center Staff Available for Students

incident_details: School received an unconfirmed report of a prohibited item on school grounds. Two hours later, a caller at the school said a student was allegedly wearing tactical gear and was in the school with a gun.
Various schools in the area received threats, promoting more law enforcement presence.
Teenager created a social media post threatening a school shooting.

school: El Camino Real Charter High School

incident_details: Written message of "I'm finna bomb TS school on Friday, FR" found in a school bathroom.
School received a threat where an individual said that he and six others would come to the school armed with AR-15's

precautions: Law Enforcement remained on campus for the day

incident_details: School received threat, which closed all schools in the Oak Lawn School District 123. Appears someone may have used a student's identity in the swatting incident. Several staff members received a serious and threatening message directed toward the school.
School went on lockdown after a phone call from Philadelphia resulted in a threat

precautions: Law Enforcement Presence the Remainder of the Day

incident_details: Both Wayne High School and Elementary School received a call about a shooter coming to school
911 received multiple 911 calls about a possible school shooter at the school
Bomb Threat called into the Willet Science Center
Anonymous person called the school and claimed to be armed and inside the school
Call came in the form of a computerized, prerecorded message

law_enforcement: DeKalb County School District Police Department
incident_details: Bomb Threat called in to 911 while a Girl's basketball game was going on
Student told another student not to come to school the following day because he claimed to have a gun.

school: Jepson High School and Vacaville High School
incident_details: Two incidents lead to rumors on social media about the incidents, including a shooting and a hitlist at Jepson and a shooting at Vacaville
School received an anonymous out of state phone call where a threat was conveyed.

school: Harrand Creek Elementary School and Pinedale Elementary School
precautions: Law Enforcement remained on campus for the day
Increased Law Enforcement Presence for Monday

incident_details: AI Internet Generated Bomb Threat Call. Multiple schools across Texas received the same call.
Swatting Incident leads to an arrest

precautions: Armed Security to Remain on Campus
charges: Two Counts of Threatening to Harm Via Electronic Device

incident_details: Schools closed include: Mount Ararat Middle and High School, Bowdoin Central School, Bowdoinham Community School, Williams-Cone Elementary School, and Woodside Elementary School after bomb threats were called into each school.
Multiple Schools in the District received bomb threats via email with racially and politically motivated verbiage

school: Nitro High School and Dupont Middle School
incident_details: Three schools in the same county received threats. Also reported that Lincoln County High School received a message.
School received an anonymous phone call where a person claimed they had a gun, were going to shoot up the campus, and blow themselves up

school: Schools on Minot Air Force Base
incident_details: Person made remarks about bombs and a threat to schools on the military base. The person drove to the base and was detained by security at the gate of the military base until law enforcement arrived.
School received a voicemail where a person said there were five bombs at the school and that they had an AR-15 and a suicide vest
FBI notified law enforcement about a bomb threat mentioning Plainview Public Schools.
School received an anonymous threat, prompting a campus-wide lockdown
Student sent an email to over 300 other students that said, "At 2pm we will rise up and kill all the Jews in this school and the city. F*** the Jews."
charges: Making a Terroristic Threat and Aggravated Harassment as a Hate Crime

incident_details: Student wrote on the school bathroom wall, "school shooting Feb 4th:)". Student who wrote the threat said a person she only communicates with online dared her to do it, that she was bored, and that she did not think it was going to be a big deal or a serious matter.
charges: Written threat to commit a mass shooting or terrorism act

incident_details: School received a threatening phone call claiming that a suspicious device was in a campus parking lot. The call appeared to be a recorded message.
School received a third bomb threat in a month, leading to the school to close for the day.
Law Enforcement received reports of a potentially armed person on campus, leading to three other schools in the area to lockdown. Law Enforcement determined there was no active shooter or threat.

Two different written school shooting threats were found on the bathroom walls. The writings were different but both referenced a social media post that was circulating that threatened the school. The most recent threat led to many parents keeping their kids home from school.
precautions: Increased Law Enforcement Presence and Increased Security Measures on Campus. Counselors available for student support.

incident_details: School received a phone call where the caller claimed to be armed inside the restrooms.
Student made threatening statements regarding the school
School received a bomb threat through the non-emergency line.
Individual walking by the school made a threat and was contacted by the School's SRO.
School received two threatening phone calls, resulting in the school going into lockdown twice.

school: Cape Henlopen High School, Dover High School and Kent County Secondary ILC
incident_details: Multiple bomb threats result in delayed school openings and transportation disruption. Bomb threats were left at Dover High School and Kent County Secondary ILC at 1:00 a.m. Pauda Academy, Concord High School, and Cab Calloway School of the Arts also received bomb threats.
911 call received about an armed person on school property. Police determined it to be a swatting call.
Student got upset and made general threats towards the school
Student reported through the SafeUT app that they heard there may be a threat connected to the planned walkout protesting ICE.

In a letter to parents, the Superintendent of Schools reported that a student shared information with a staff member that could have been interpreted as a potential threat.  Police determined the threat to be non-credible.
Student compiled a list of staff members and non-specific first names upon which they wished harmed. Administrators learned of the list January 30, when a student emailed a screenshot of the list.
School received a bomb threat for a second day in a row, prompting school to close for the day
School decided to cancel classes for the day due to threats circulating on social media and through phone calls
Suspect called the school and threatened that there would be a massacre shooting at the school that day
School received a threatening phone call, resulting in a lockdown, evacuation, and postponement of a soccer game.
School received a third threat in the same week and fourth in less than a month.
Written threat found on the grounds of the high school
Student sent written threats to kill, along with two photographs of a gun in a group message over Snapchat. Student said they were meant as jokes that got out of hand.
charges: Written threats to kill or do bodily harm to another person

incident_details: Student threatened to kill classmates in a music video he posted to social media. Student had previously made threats to the victims by threatening to blow up their houses and fight them. In the music video, the student described how he would shoot the victims and said statements like "I will end you".
charges: Three counts of written or electronic threats to kill, do bodily injury, conduct a mass shooting, or act of terrorism

incident_details: Suspect made threatening comments on a social media platform towards Center Grove Community School Corporation, which placed school staff, students, and families in fear. Suspect wrote the following message to the school: "I'm walking in tomorrow with [a firearm] and killing everyone that's in my sight. Better have yo school and shut down. Racist ass piece shit school. Be careful tomorrow."
Student was arrested for making a threat to carry out a school shooting on social media. Student posted online them holding a gun and warning people not to go to school.
School investigated an unverified, anonoymous threat after it was reported
precautions: Increased Law Enforcement Presence on Campus

incident_details: School said the first threat was made by phone against an "iSchool" at the University Park campus, followed by a threat to the Creekside campus
School received a bomb threat, resulting in an early dismissal
precautions: Students required to leave backpacks at home

incident_details: School received a bomb threat, prompting an evacuation
Hale High School, Hale Middle School, and MacArthur Elementary School all received threatening phone calls
School received a threat, prompting a lockdown
School received a phone call from a person claiming to have been a former student at the school 10 years ago. Caller said they were coming to campus with a bomb
School received an AI-Generated Threat, prompting an evacuation and early dismissal

school: San Diego High School and Garfield High School
incident_details: San Diego High School received a threat at the same time as Helix Charter High School from the same phone number.

school: Premier High School in Corpus Christi
incident_details: School received a bomb threat, prompting an early dismissal
School investigated a threat, prompting a cautionary lockdown
Caller claimed there was a bomb in a dorm at the University
charges: Making Terroristic Threats and Causing False Public Alarm

incident_details: Deputies investigated a possible threat at the school that was heard over a radio signal

School was aware of a social media post that apparently threatened a shooting at the school due to a planned protest. Apparently the message referenced bringing a gun to school and harming others, while comments under the district's post also indicated the alleged threat may be connected to a potential protest planned by the students.

Suspect drove in the school parking lot erratically and parked his vehicle. Suspect walked out of his vehicle with a knife in his hand. Suspect began banging on the doors with the knife in his hand and several children witnessed the incident and were scared. Suspect was intoxicated and search of the vehicle turned up another six knives.
charges: Threats of Violence, Possessing a Dangerous Weapon on School Property, First Degree Damage to Property, and Driving While Intoxicated

incident_details: School received a phone call in which the caller stated they were in one od the bathrooms with a gun.

school: Fernley High School and Silverland Middle School
incident_details: In wake of a student led protest, law enforcement received multiple phone calls, messages, and other communications relaying possible threats of fights, shootings, and other violent behavior.

School District notified families that a social media threat was directed towards the school and a police officer. Suspect who made the threat was already known to law enforcement and has a documented history of behavioral health-related concerns.
Student made a comment on Sunday involving the threat of a shooting that would target the school the next day.
A juvenile outside the state of Illinois made a threat on Snapchat that was directed toward students who attend Montini Catholic High School

Multiple Schools for Columbus City Schools and Springfield City Schools received bomb threats (over 30 schools). Schools threatened include: Indian Springs Elementary School, Forest Park Elementary School, Georgian Heights Elementary School. The threats in Springfield specifically mentioned how Haitian Immigrants needed to get out.
University of St. Thomas campuses in St. Paul and Minneapolis both went into Shelter in Place after receiving a threat
District initiated their safety protocol after receiving a report that a student might bring a weapon to school
Police received a report of a possible planned shooting at the high school
